598373:
The couch house is very nicely appointed (cool, unusual art, nice bathroom fixtures and a very comfortable bed) and in a beautiful location near the main street, however we didn't love our stay for a few reasons obvious within the notes below. 

Things to note:
- BRING TORCHES. It's pitch black and very uneven ground with no pathway past the tennis court, you'll need to hobble over a wall to get past the nets. Feels quite dangerous in the dark. 
- Bring soap for the shower, only liquid hand soap is provided. Don't get caught out.
- Always change in the bathroom, there's another Air Bnb on the grounds and the blinds are not thick enough for that level of privacy.
- We luckily brought thermals, do the same. It's not well insulated.
- Check the water before you go to bed. We used the gas heater for 3-4 hours earlier in the evening and woke up to no gas for hot water (showers). 
You need to contact the owner for instruction to change it yourself, appreciate that it's not easy to judge the level of gas usage left but it's not nice to go a day without a shower.
- At the time, there was a possum or rats in the roof leading to a sleepless night. Hope this doesn't happen to you! 

All things are fixable for future guests except the entry point and Daniel was kind enough to check on us after we checked out. He appears to be quite a nice and hospitable host with unfortunate issues that just may not have been raised prior.
